metadata.titel_preek: Epiphany: The Fear of the Lord and the Irruption of Grace

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God invades the mundane and sinful reality of human life to sovereignly bestow salvation and a new identity, overcoming human resistance and fear.

tekstueel_bewijs: God draws near to them both
God will interrupt the normal progression of things by arriving in—indeed, invading—the midst of human events
Jesus stoops down to us in our miserable condition

object.identificatie: Salvation, New Life, and the 'Enabling Word'
tekstueel_bewijs: the firm ground of their salvation
bringing the gifts of new life

zender.identificatie: The Holy One of Israel / The Source of Mercy
tekstueel_bewijs: all good things come not from within ourselves but as mercy from above

ontvanger.identificatie: The Sinful Human (Gideon, Peter, the Hearer, the Addict)
tekstueel_bewijs: You and I are deep in sin
the God who terrifies is also the one who loves us for all eternity
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies strictly with the Receiver (the one in the blanket).

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Word / The Angel
tekstueel_bewijs: the angel of the Lord is equivalent to the Lord himself
helper.rol_van_god: God is both Subject and Helper (Self-mediating).
helper.rol_van_geest: External help that creates internal capacity.

tekstueel_bewijs: our selfishness, greed, idolatry, cruelty, pettiness, pomposity, vanity, and self-deceit
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as a power that would lead to being 'lost' if not for divine intervention.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The response of the saved person: following and serving.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Redeemed (Peter/Gideon/Hearer)
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Catching men / Smiting Midianites / Confessing Lordship
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics/mission) only begins after the primary program (grace) has established the 'firm ground of salvation'.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God draws near to them both.
He puts redemption into our blanket.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We clutch our privileges to ourselves.
They left everything and followed him.

voorbeelden: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom (as a structural reality, not a command).
We can understand and even admire the hope... for something better.
The awareness of sin comes only to those who are already standing on the firm ground.
Power capable of calling into existence the things that do not exist.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is heavily focused on God's 'Pouvoir' (Power/Ability) to act where the human 'Pouvoir' is non-existent.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from ~S1 (Sinful state) to S2 (Terror of God's holiness) to ~S2 (The 'Fear Not' of Grace) to S1 (New Creation).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God taking S2 (Judgment) upon Himself in Christ to grant S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. God is described as 'opposed to us' in our sin.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the active Subject and humans as the passive, often resistant, receivers of an unconditional gift.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: They left everything and followed him.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He does not ask if we are working to turn ourselves around... he puts redemption into our blanket.
If your rebelliousness and mine were allowed to play themselves out to the end, we would be lost.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are used to show human incompetence and God's surprising choice, not as models of virtue.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The preacher explicitly notes Gideon is 'not in the least a mighty man of valor' and Peter is 'sinful', making God's action the focus.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; removal of the burden of self-improvement as a prerequisite for God.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'terror' of the Law/Holiness to the 'peace' of the Gospel is perfectly integrated.
spanning_punten: The paradox of God being 'opposed to us' yet 'for us'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all... paying in his own body the price of sin.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit/Word bestows the 'Pouvoir' (Fear not) that the human lacks.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is an addiction and a rebelliousness that leads to being 'lost'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is powered by God's 'irruption' into human helplessness.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a classic 'Epiphany' structure.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in grace-oriented homiletics. It refuses to turn the biblical characters into moral examples, insisting instead on God as the only Subject capable of acting in the face of human sin.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis might focus on the 'funny' Gideon anecdote, Greimasian analysis shows that this humor serves to deconstruct the human Subject to make room for the Divine Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the context of Midianites; semiotics explains that the Midianites are a 'Light Opponent' compared to the 'Heavy Opponent' of Gideon's own fear and sin.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: The 'blanket' metaphor functions as a perfect semiotic 'Object' of value that is received while the Subject (the addict) is asleep (passive).

appendices.notities: The sermon follows Fleming Rutledge's rule almost perfectly.
